title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson and Dayana Slade were arrested in Maine for the fatal shooting of Mike Jonas in Brockton.
Thompson faces a first degree murder charge, while Slade is charged as an accessory; both pleaded not guilty.
Jonas was shot and stabbed on Sept. 23, 2025, at Finnegan Park; police identified Thompson as the shooter.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels shortstop Zach Neto this offseason, according to reports.
Neto has achieved two consecutive 20-20 seasons and is under team control until 2029 with the Angels.
Instead of trading top prospects, the Red Sox acquired Caleb Durbin, a versatile player from the Brewers.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, 72, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to one day in jail for bribing an RMV employee.
Cardosa bribed a Brockton RMV examiner at least $20,000 for 100-300 applicants from August 2019 to April 2021.
Cardosa's sentence includes six months home incarceration and a $5,500 fine, influenced by his health issues post-assault in 2022.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Patriots' Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Cardi B and Stefon Diggs publicly appeared together first at a Celtics and Knicks playoff game in May 2025.
Stefon Diggs faces felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault charges; his arraignment is scheduled for February 13.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bad Bunny for representing Puerto Rico during Super Bowl LX's Spanish-language halftime show.
Cora expressed pride in seeing Puerto Rican culture highlighted, referencing elements like coconut stands and beauty parlors.
Despite political controversy, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell supported Bad Bunny, praising his unifying performance at the event.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage of police response to a Brown University mass shooting in December.
The shooting left two students dead and nine injured; the suspect later killed an MIT professor and himself.
The footage documents Lt. Patrick Potter directing officers, with redactions to protect victim identities and the sensitivity of the incident.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, a San Francisco 49ers lineman, was shot in the ankle in San Francisco early Monday morning.
The shooting occurred hours after the Super Bowl, played at Levi's Stadium, during an altercation involving two groups.
White underwent surgery for his non-life-threatening injuries; no arrests have been made in the incident.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum assigned to the Maine Celtics for practice as part of Achilles injury recovery.
Tatum has participated in controlled scrimmages and public workouts, signaling ahead-of-schedule progress.
Celtics' Brad Stevens emphasizes Tatum's return depends on full health and clearance from medical staff.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers were rescued from Camel's Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont, amid sub-zero temperatures and deep snow.
A 21-year-old man and 19-year-old woman were found suffering from hypothermia after calling 911 for help on February 7.
Rescuers reached them by 11:20 p.m., with the woman hospitalized; both are expected to recover fully.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots plan to enhance their offensive line after significant struggles in the Super Bowl against Seattle's defense.
New England aims to add offensive weapons for quarterback Drake Maye, considering options like A.J. Brown and Alec Pierce.
The team seeks to bolster depth via the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on positions like offensive tackle and edge rusher.
